meanings.definition: The quality or state of being repressive.
meanings.sent1: The repressivenesses of the strict rules made everyone feel suffocated.
meanings.sent2: The repressivenesses of the government's control limited people's freedom.
meanings.sent3: The repressivenesses of the teacher's grading system made students fear making mistakes.
meanings.sent4: The repressivenesses of the dark clouds seemed to weigh heavily on the town.
meanings.sent5: The repressivenesses of the silence in the room was palpable.

meanings.definition: The act of repressing or suppressing something.
meanings.sent1: Her repressivenesses of emotions led to a buildup of stress.
meanings.sent2: The repressivenesses of the information by the government raised suspicions.
meanings.sent3: The repressivenesses of the cat trying to hide its toy was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The repressivenesses of the dam holding back the water was a powerful sight.
meanings.sent5: The repressivenesses of the lid on the jar made it difficult to open.
